slides.title: Welcome to Applied Chemistry
slides.content:
# Introduction to Applied Chemistry

Welcome to **Applied Chemistry** - where chemistry meets everyday life!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Fuels and Energy** - Combustion and energy sources
- **Food Chemistry** - Nutrients and additives
- **Pharmaceuticals** - Drug chemistry
- **Materials Science** - Polymers and composites

> **Fun Fact:** Everything you eat, wear, and use involves applied chemistry!

## Areas of Applied Chemistry:

| Field | Applications |
|-------|-------------|
| Energy | Fuels, batteries |
| Medicine | Drugs, diagnostics |
| Agriculture | Fertilizers, pesticides |
| Materials | Plastics, metals |
| Food | Preservation, nutrition |

slides.title: Fuels
slides.content:
# Fuels and Combustion

## Types of Fuels:

| Type | Examples | Source |
|------|----------|--------|
| Fossil | Coal, oil, gas | Ancient organisms |
| Biofuel | Biodiesel, ethanol | Plants |
| Nuclear | Uranium | Radioactive decay |
| Hydrogen | H2 | Electrolysis |

## Combustion:

```
Fuel + O2 -> CO2 + H2O + Energy
```

**Complete combustion:** Enough O2, produces CO2
**Incomplete:** Limited O2, produces CO or soot

## Calorific Value:

Energy released per unit mass (kJ/g).

| Fuel | Calorific Value |
|------|----------------|
| Hydrogen | 142 kJ/g |
| Natural gas | 55 kJ/g |
| Gasoline | 47 kJ/g |
| Coal | 30 kJ/g |
| Wood | 17 kJ/g |

## Octane Rating:

Resistance to engine knock.
- Higher octane = more compression before ignition
- Iso-octane = 100
- n-heptane = 0

## Alternative Fuels:
- Biodiesel (from vegetable oil)
- Bioethanol (from fermentation)
- Hydrogen fuel cells

slides.title: Batteries
slides.content:
# Batteries and Energy Storage

## Battery Basics:

**Anode:** Oxidation (- terminal)
**Cathode:** Reduction (+ terminal)
**Electrolyte:** Ion transport

## Types:

| Type | Chemistry | Rechargeable |
|------|-----------|-------------|
| Alkaline | Zn/MnO2 | No |
| Lead-acid | Pb/PbO2 | Yes |
| Lithium-ion | Li compounds | Yes |
| NiMH | Ni/Metal hydride | Yes |

## Lithium-ion Battery:

- High energy density
- Lightweight
- Used in phones, laptops, EVs
- Cathode: LiCoO2
- Anode: Graphite

## Lead-Acid Battery:

```
Pb + PbO2 + 2H2SO4 -> 2PbSO4 + 2H2O
```

Used in cars.

## Fuel Cells:

```
2H2 + O2 -> 2H2O + electricity
```

- Continuous fuel supply
- Water is only byproduct
- Used in space, vehicles

slides.title: Food Chemistry
slides.content:
# Food Chemistry

## Major Nutrients:

| Nutrient | Function | Source |
|----------|----------|--------|
| Carbohydrates | Energy | Grains, fruits |
| Proteins | Growth, repair | Meat, beans |
| Fats | Energy, insulation | Oils, dairy |
| Vitamins | Various functions | Fruits, vegetables |
| Minerals | Bones, metabolism | Various foods |

## Energy Content:

| Nutrient | Energy (kcal/g) |
|----------|----------------|
| Carbohydrates | 4 |
| Proteins | 4 |
| Fats | 9 |
| Alcohol | 7 |

## Food Additives:

| Type | Purpose | Examples |
|------|---------|----------|
| Preservatives | Prevent spoilage | Salt, nitrates |
| Antioxidants | Prevent oxidation | Vitamin E, BHT |
| Colorants | Appearance | Caramel, FD&C dyes |
| Flavors | Taste | MSG, vanilla |
| Emulsifiers | Mix oil/water | Lecithin |

## Food Processing:

- Pasteurization (heat kills bacteria)
- Fermentation (alcohol, yogurt)
- Irradiation (kills microbes)
- Canning (sterilization)

slides.title: Pharmaceutical Chemistry
slides.content:
# Pharmaceutical Chemistry

## Drug Development:

1. Target identification
2. Lead compound discovery
3. Optimization
4. Preclinical testing
5. Clinical trials (Phases I-III)
6. Regulatory approval
7. Market

## Drug Action:

**Receptor binding:**
- Agonists: activate receptor
- Antagonists: block receptor

**Enzyme inhibition:**
- Competitive
- Non-competitive

## Common Drug Classes:

| Class | Action | Examples |
|-------|--------|----------|
| Analgesics | Pain relief | Aspirin, morphine |
| Antibiotics | Kill bacteria | Penicillin |
| Antivirals | Fight viruses | Acyclovir |
| Antacids | Neutralize acid | Mg(OH)2 |

## Aspirin:

```
C9H8O4 (acetylsalicylic acid)
```

- Inhibits COX enzymes
- Reduces pain, fever, inflammation
- Blood thinner

## Drug Delivery:

- Oral tablets/capsules
- Injections
- Transdermal patches
- Inhalers

slides.title: Materials Science
slides.content:
# Materials Science

## Material Categories:

| Type | Properties | Examples |
|------|------------|----------|
| Metals | Conductive, strong | Steel, Al |
| Ceramics | Hard, heat-resistant | Glass, pottery |
| Polymers | Flexible, light | Plastics, rubber |
| Composites | Combined properties | Fiberglass, carbon fiber |

## Metals and Alloys:

| Alloy | Components | Properties |
|-------|------------|------------|
| Steel | Fe + C | Strong |
| Stainless | Fe + Cr + Ni | Corrosion-resistant |
| Bronze | Cu + Sn | Hard |
| Brass | Cu + Zn | Machinable |

## Polymers:

| Polymer | Use |
|---------|-----|
| Polyethylene | Bags, bottles |
| PVC | Pipes, flooring |
| Nylon | Clothing, rope |
| Kevlar | Body armor |

## Composites:

Two or more materials combined.

- **Fiberglass:** Glass fibers in polymer
- **Carbon fiber:** Carbon fibers in epoxy
- **Concrete:** Cement + aggregate

## Smart Materials:

- Shape memory alloys
- Piezoelectric materials
- Self-healing polymers

slides.title: Fertilizers
slides.content:
# Fertilizers

## Essential Plant Nutrients:

**Primary (NPK):**
- N (Nitrogen): Leaf growth
- P (Phosphorus): Roots, flowers
- K (Potassium): Overall health

**Secondary:**
- Calcium, Magnesium, Sulfur

## Common Fertilizers:

| Fertilizer | Formula | Nutrient |
|------------|---------|----------|
| Ammonium nitrate | NH4NO3 | N |
| Urea | CO(NH2)2 | N |
| Superphosphate | Ca(H2PO4)2 | P |
| Potassium chloride | KCl | K |

## NPK Rating:

Example: 10-10-10
- 10% N, 10% P2O5, 10% K2O

## Haber Process:

```
N2 + 3H2 <-> 2NH3
```

Conditions: 450 C, 200 atm, Fe catalyst

## Environmental Concerns:

- Runoff causes eutrophication
- N2O is greenhouse gas
- Groundwater contamination

## Organic Alternatives:

- Compost
- Manure
- Bone meal
- Fish emulsion

slides.title: Soaps and Detergents
slides.content:
# Soaps and Detergents

## Soap:

**Made by saponification:**
```
Fat + NaOH -> Soap + Glycerol
```

**Structure:**
- Hydrophilic head (carboxylate)
- Hydrophobic tail (hydrocarbon)

## How Cleaning Works:

1. Hydrophobic tails attach to grease
2. Form micelles around dirt
3. Water carries micelles away

## Soap vs Detergent:

| Property | Soap | Detergent |
|----------|------|----------|
| Source | Natural fats | Petroleum |
| Hard water | Forms scum | Works well |
| Biodegradable | Yes | Varies |
| pH | Basic | Can be neutral |

## Detergent Structure:

- Sodium lauryl sulfate (SLS)
- Linear alkyl benzenesulfonate (LAS)

## Additives:

| Additive | Purpose |
|----------|--------|
| Builders | Soften water |
| Brighteners | UV fluorescence |
| Enzymes | Break down stains |
| Bleaches | Whitening |
| Fragrances | Smell |

slides.title: Corrosion
slides.content:
# Corrosion

**Corrosion** = oxidation of metals by environment.

## Rusting of Iron:

```
4Fe + 3O2 + 6H2O -> 4Fe(OH)3
```

Requires:
- Oxygen
- Water
- Electrolyte (salt speeds it up)

## Electrochemical Mechanism:

**Anode:** Fe -> Fe2+ + 2e-
**Cathode:** O2 + 2H2O + 4e- -> 4OH-

## Prevention Methods:

| Method | How It Works |
|--------|-------------|
| Painting | Barrier |
| Oiling/Greasing | Barrier |
| Galvanizing | Zinc coating |
| Electroplating | Metal coating |
| Cathodic protection | Sacrificial anode |
| Alloying | Stainless steel |

## Galvanizing:

Zinc coating on iron.
- Even if scratched, Zn corrodes preferentially
- Zn is more reactive than Fe

## Cathodic Protection:

- Attach more reactive metal (Mg, Zn)
- This metal corrodes instead
- Used on ships, pipelines

slides.title: Cosmetics
slides.content:
# Chemistry of Cosmetics

## Skin Care:

| Product | Key Ingredients |
|---------|----------------|
| Moisturizer | Glycerin, oils |
| Sunscreen | Zinc oxide, avobenzone |
| Anti-aging | Retinol, peptides |
| Cleanser | Surfactants |

## Sunscreen:

**Physical:** Zinc oxide, titanium dioxide
- Reflect/scatter UV

**Chemical:** Avobenzone, oxybenzone
- Absorb UV

**SPF:** Sun Protection Factor
- SPF 30 blocks 97% UVB

## Hair Products:

**Shampoo:** Surfactants remove oil
**Conditioner:** Cationic agents smooth cuticle
**Hair dye:**
- Temporary: coats hair
- Permanent: penetrates cortex

## Nail Polish:

- Film former (nitrocellulose)
- Plasticizer (flexibility)
- Colorants
- Solvent (evaporates to dry)

## Testing:

- pH testing
- Stability testing
- Safety testing
- Efficacy testing

slides.title: Industrial Chemistry
slides.content:
# Industrial Chemistry

## Important Industrial Processes:

### Haber Process (Ammonia):
```
N2 + 3H2 <-> 2NH3
```
Conditions: 450 C, 200 atm, Fe catalyst

### Contact Process (Sulfuric Acid):
```
2SO2 + O2 -> 2SO3 (V2O5 catalyst)
SO3 + H2O -> H2SO4
```

### Chlor-Alkali Process:
Electrolysis of NaCl solution:
```
Products: Cl2, NaOH, H2
```

## Sulfuric Acid Uses:

| Use | Percentage |
|-----|------------|
| Fertilizers | 60% |
| Chemicals | 15% |
| Petroleum refining | 5% |
| Batteries | 5% |

## Industrial Catalysts:

| Process | Catalyst |
|---------|----------|
| Haber | Iron |
| Contact | V2O5 |
| Hydrogenation | Nickel |
| Catalytic cracking | Zeolites |

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Applied Chemistry Summary

## Fuels:
- Combustion releases energy
- Calorific value = energy per gram
- Alternatives: biofuels, hydrogen

## Batteries:
- Electrochemical cells store energy
- Lithium-ion dominant today
- Fuel cells use continuous fuel

## Food Chemistry:
- Macronutrients: carbs, proteins, fats
- Additives preserve, color, flavor

## Pharmaceuticals:
- Drug development is multi-stage
- Drugs work via receptors/enzymes

## Materials:
| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Metals/Alloys | Steel, brass |
| Polymers | Plastics |
| Composites | Carbon fiber |

## Industrial:
- Haber, Contact, Chlor-alkali processes
- Catalysts enable efficient production

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Applied Chemistry!
